question: Where is most of Earth's freshwater located?

content.source_1: About 96% of Earth’s water is salt water in the oceans, and the remaining 4% is freshwater.
content.source_2: Roughly two-thirds of Earth’s freshwater is stored in glaciers and ice caps, making them the largest single reservoir of freshwater.
content.source_3: The Antarctic and Greenland ice sheets contain nearly all land ice; Antarctica alone holds around 90% of the world’s glacial ice volume.
content.source_4: Groundwater contains far more freshwater than all rivers and lakes combined and supplies most of the freshwater used by people.
content.source_5: Surface freshwater in rivers, lakes, and swamps together makes up well under 1% of Earth’s freshwater.
content.source_6: The atmosphere and soil moisture together hold only a minute fraction of Earth’s freshwater at any time compared with glaciers, ice sheets, and groundwater.
